definition: to send out/to show (one's feeling)/to issue/to develop/to make a bundle of money/classifier for gunshots (rounds)

sentences.english: Without experiences in mind, he pledged he would never let his own two-year old son face such difficulties.
sentences.chinese: 他发誓不会让自己两岁的儿子生活得那么艰辛。

sentences.english: The general swore to take back this island whatever the cost.
sentences.chinese: 我位将军发誓不惜任何代价夺回这个岛。

sentences.english: My boyfriend have ever sweared to love me forever.
sentences.chinese: 我男朋友曾发誓说永远爱我。

sentences.english: He has vowed never to enter the ring again.
sentences.chinese: 他发誓再也不进斗牛场了。

sentences.english: I swore that I would take part in the voting with all my soul.
sentences.chinese: 我暗自对天发誓，下次投票我一定全心投入。

sentences.english: She swears that she will be avenged on her enemy sooner or later.
sentences.chinese: 她发誓迟早要向她的敌人报仇。

sentences.english: I swear by my brow groomer.
I swear, your love is all my life, what do you think?
sentences.chinese: 发誓此生之中你为我最爱，又何想？

sentences.english: He promised never to betray the organization.
Abraham makes his servant put his hand under his thigh while swearing to God.
sentences.chinese: 亚伯拉罕让他的仆人把手放在他的大腿下向上帝发誓。

sentences.english: I have spent my life vowed, I will work hard to not lose to anyone.
sentences.chinese: 我用我的生命发誓，我会努力，不输给任何人。

sentences.english: Iago. I protest, in the sincerity of love and honest kindness.
sentences.chinese: 伊阿古我发誓这一种意思完全出于一片诚心。

sentences.english: He stands pledged to abolish slavery in Columbia (the district round Washington) under the conditions we have shown.
sentences.chinese: 他发誓要在现有的情况下废除哥伦比亚特区的奴隶制。

sentences.english: I once swore again ignore her affair, accurate is again have been already failed to keep agree.
sentences.chinese: 我曾发誓说再不管她的事情，到底是又食言了。

sentences.english: Robert swears he will love me for ever and ever.
sentences.chinese: 罗伯特发誓他将永远爱我。

sentences.english: I swear, this was the only traffic light we ever passed in Xinyang.
sentences.chinese: 我发誓，这是唯一的交通灯都过去了，我们在信阳。

definition: lit. to eat one's words/to break a promise/to go back on one's word/to renege/unsworn testimony
completely correcting one's former misdeeds (idiom); to repent past mistakes and turn over a new leaf/a reformed character
to be as good as one's word (idiom)/to keep one's promise
to take revenge and wipe out a grudge (idiom)
